Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the onion and garlic until limp. Add the green pepper. Cook and stir until tender. Drain the tomatoes, reserving juice, and pour them into the skillet. Season with thyme, parsley, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the frozen okra, and pour in enough of the reserved juice from the tomatoes to cover the bottom of the pan. Cover, and cook for 15 minutes, or until okra is tender.

Heat oil in a tahnabour and fry the wheat, yogurt, water, egg, flour, salt, onion, butter, mint, parsley. Fry for a few minutes. Add the wheat, yogurt, water, egg, flour, salt, onion, butter, mint, parsley. Add the wheat, yogurt, water, egg, flour, salt, onion, butter, mint, pars

In crock pot, combine beans, ham, carrots, onion and pepper. Stir in undrained tomatoes and broth. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hrs or high for 3-4 hours. Stir in kale or spinach just before serving. Sprinkle each serving with parmesan cheese, if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg in a large bowl. Add apple slices. Sprinkle water and lemon juice over apple slices and toss until smooth. Dab on top of apples. Bake for 50- 60 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place chicken in baking dish. Combine mustard, honey and curry powder. Spread over chicken pieces. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Baste while baking and be careful that sauce does not burn.
Preheat oven to 350. Place paula deen sweet potato balls in a large baking dish. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes until bubbly.
Combine ingredients. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover 10 minutes before done and let brown.
Mix greens, apple, cranberries, walnuts, parmesan cheese, walnut oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, salt and pepper. Mix dressing ingredients in small bowl, pour over salad. Toss. Serve.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the penne pasta, and cook until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place bacon in the skillet, and cook until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, and cook until heated through. Place the spinach into a colander, and drain the hot pasta over it so it is wilted. Transfer to a large serving bowl, and toss with the remaining olive oil, and the bacon and tomato mixture.

Heat grill to high. Melt butter in a frying pan and fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute. Toast the bread, top with the mushrooms and then the cheese. Grill until cheese is brown and bubbly.

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.

In a blender, blend apricot, sugar, water, dried apricot, apricots, lemon juice, almond extract. Pour into loaf pan and freeze 4 hours till hard. Puree again for 30 minutes before serving. Return to freezer till time to serve. Garnish and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Add the egg white and beat with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 275f degrees. In a large pyrex baking dish, thoroughly mix all ingredients for sauce. Put the brisket in the baking dish, and turn it over once to coat it with the sauce. Sela the dish tightly with havy-duty aluminum foil. Bake at 275f degrees. For 5 to 7 hours. Remove from oven and allow to stand for 1 hour before slicing. Slice across the grain, and serve with sauce. Makes 8 to 10 servings. Be sure to use a pyrex baking dish or a very heavy metal pan. Also, before you prepare the brisket, remove it from the refrigerator far enough ahead of time to allow it to come to room temperature.

Heat 2 teaspoons of oil over high heat and add 4 rashers of butter and cook for 2-3 minutes or until crip and then set aside. Heat another 2 teaspoons of oil in the pan and add chopped brown onion and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes, 2 sprigs thyme, chicken stock and water and bring to the boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Blend until smooth and stir through cream. Divide into serving bowls and top with crispy bacon to serve.

In a medium saucepan mix all ingredients together. Bring to a light boil, whisking constantly until thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly then whisk in mayo. Season with salt and pepper. Cool completely before adding to you potato or pasta salad.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll rolls into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked sausage, cooked bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place pizza dough on a lightly greased pizza pan and press out to 12 inches. Evenly distribute alfredo sauce. Evenly distribute crab meat. Evenly distribute cheddar and motzarella cheeses. Top with the old bay seasoning, onions, bacon and mushrooms. Bake on the lowest rack for 20-25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream butter, sugar and lemonade mix until fluffy. Beat in egg, vanilla and lemon extract. In a separate bowl, mix flour and baking soda. Add dry ingredients to batter, beating until thoroughly combined. Form dough into 1-inch ball and roll in granulated sugar. Place balls 2-inch apart on well-greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges begin to brown.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, combine tuna, celery, onion, cheese, olives, mayo and pepper. Divide tuna mixture evenly among 4 buns. Wrap sandwiches loosely in aluminum foil. Place tuna mixture evenly among 4 buns. Bake 15-20 minutes or until heated through.

In a medium-size pot, bring water to a boil. Stir in the spices, cover, and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the pre-brewed coffee. Meanwhile, in a saucepan, heat milk until almost boiling. Strain the coffee through a fine mesh strainer covered with cheesecloth into the milk. Add sweetener, stir, and serve in mugs.

In dutch oven or electric skillet, heat oil. Add onion, saute 2 min, add beef, cook and stir until done. Add milk, butter and spices, stir until creamy. Fold in macaroni. Top with cheese, cover and heat until cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Arange shrimp in a single layer in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine lemon juice with butter, garlic, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper, and red pepper. Pour mixture over shrimp. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 minutes or until shrimp are done. Sprinkle parsley over shrimp. Serve immediately. Serving size is 3 ounces shrimp with 2 tablespoons sauce with 3 points per serving.

Mix all ingredients except the whole milk and butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer and stir in the vanilla. Cook until just about all of the milk is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut chicken in half. Arrange, skin side up, in a roasting pan. Combine butter, lemon juice, and spices in a small bowl and mix well. Brush chicken with mixture. Roast until juices run clear. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 1 hour. At 350 degrees.

Heat oven to 350f. Cook ground beef, stirring occasionally until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in rice, soup, chilies, and taco seasoning mix. Spoon into 12 x 8-inch baking pan. Top with tomatoes cheese and corn chips. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar. Mix well. Pour dressing over salad mixture, stirring well. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend.

Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl. Melt butter in the microwave, let cool it cool to lukewarm temperature. Add warm water or milk to dry mixture, then add butter. Mix all ingredients together and let stand for a minute. Add flour to the mixture and stir until it forms a ball. Flour countertop, dump out the dough and knead for at least five minutes or until dough no longer sticks to counter. Place in greased bowl and cover. Let rise for 1 hour, then punch the dough down. Let rise for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Place dough into breadpan and bake at 325 for 1 hour and 30 minutes.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot add the thyme, carrots, celery and onions. Sweat these over very low heat for about 5 minutes. Then, add the kale. Cover tightly and cook the kale until it wilts to half its volume. Add the tomatoes and 2 cups of stock. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover. Allow the stew to come a boil. Add the zucchini. Simmer for one more hour, then add the beans. If necessary, add more water to your desired consistency, and cook 45 minutes longer.

In a food processor, cream the butter and egg until light. Add the flours, salt and nutmeg, then process for 1 minute. Scrape down the bowl, and process for another minute. The dough should forma ball around the middle spindle. Wrap the dough in plastic, and let rest, chilled, for about 2 hours, until stiff enough to shape into dumplings. After the dough is rested, bring the broth to a simmer in a large soup kettle. Adjust the heat if needed to maintain a gentle simmer. Scoop the dough into balls, 1 rounded tablespoon at a time, roll into ovals, and drop into the simmering broth. After all dumplings are in the broth, simmer, covered, for 18 - 20 minutes, until the dumplings are light and puffy. Ladle the soup into serving bowls, and top with the chives.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, saute the garlic until aromatic. Add the garlic and saute for another minute or so, then add the broth. Scramble the egg, parmesean cheese, hot sauce, salt and pepper in a serving bowl. When the broth comes to a boil, add the egg mixture while stirring. Remove from heat, place in a bowl, top with fresh ground pepper, and enjoy.

Boil potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until fork-tender. Drain well. Return potatoes to pan. Mash potatoes, adding cream cheese until it is blended. Stir in milk, chives, and seasonings. Heat on medium heat until just warmed through, then serve at once.

Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettucepreparation:Combine chicken, celery

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 c. Grease small baking dish with the butter. Cut a cross in the bottom of each peach. Place cross side up in dish. Top each peach with vanilla seeds. Drizzle evenly with honey. Pour wine into dish around peaches. Bake 45 minutes or till tender. Serve with ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a medium bowl mix the flour, baking soda, and salt together. In a large bowl cream the butter and sugar together with a mixer set at medium speed. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until just mixed together. Add the flour mixture, chocolate chips, and pecans. Mix in at low speed until just mixed together. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons 2 inch apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes depending on your oven. Bake until the cookie is golden. Wait 1 minute and transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool. Wait 1 minute and transfer the

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, or until golden, but not brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and discard. Add the chickpeas and stir until coated with the oil and spices. Stir in the spinach with just the water clinging to it, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until wilted. Add the spinach and stir until coated with the oil and spices. Remove with a slotted spoon and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash and dry fish. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Place in greased shallow baking dish. Sprinkle cheese on top and cover with sour cream. Bake 25 minutes. Adjust sour cream, salt, pepper to taste as desired.

Heat coconut milk in wok and whisk curry paste in until smooth. Bring coconut milk to a boil, add chicken, then simmer for 8-10 minutes until chicken is opaque. Add eggplant, lime leaves, fish sauce, brown sugar. Taste for sweetness, saltiness etc, and correct if needed. Continue to simmer until eggplant is tender and chicken is cooked through, about 8-10 minutes more. Stir in basil leaves and chilies and serve with steamed jasmine rice.

Heat oven to 400f. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.
Mix wet ingredients. Mix dry ingredients. Combine until well incorporated. Use a cookie scoop to form dough into balls. Arrange on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9 minutes.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place cubed chicken in a ungreased rectangular baking dish, 13 x 9 x 2 inches. Bake chicken for 25-30 minutes, cook thoroughly. Meanwhile, start cooking your rice according to your package directions. Then in a large bowl, add the remaining ingredients and still well. When the chicken is done remove it from oven. Spoon in the ingredients from the bowl. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve hot over rice and be sure to get lots of the juice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl pour stuffing mix and water. Open chicken breasts, and if they are too thick to fold in half flatten and stretch them by placing on cutting board and using heavy rolling pin roll out chicken until it is able to be folded in half. Give the stuffing a quick mix with a spoon. Spoon stuffing onto one half of the chicken and fold chicken breast over to cover. Place breasts in baking pan. Continue stuffing breasts until all breasts are used. If you have left over stuffing go back and open breasts and continue stuffing until all stuffing is used. Combine soup and sour cream. Spread over chicken breasts. Cover and bake for 45 minutes to an hour until chicken is thoroughly cooked.

Preheat oven to 375f and butter and flour a 9-inch cake pan with high sides, line bottom with parchment paper. Finely grind almonds with 2 tablespoons of sugar in food processor. Mix yolks, 2 tablespoons sugar, lemon zest, cinnamon and a pinch of salt in a bowl until thick and smooth. Add almond mixture, stir. Separately beat egg whites until soft peaks form, then gradually add 4 tablespoons sugar, beating until egg whites are stiff but not dry. Fold half of egg whites gently into almond mixture, then add other half and finish folding in gently. Transfer to prepared pan. Bake until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 30-35 minutes. Cool on rack, turn out onto serving platter.

Cook beef, onion and pepper in skillet until meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper. Blend cottage cheese and cream cheese together until fluffy. Spoon noodles into grease 10x6x2 inch baking dish. Spread cheese mixture over noodles. Pour meat sauce on top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes or until heated through.

Cook noodles in a large pot of lightly salted water until al dente. While the pasta is cooking, place the eggs, grated cheese, parsley, salt and pepper into a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until well combined. When the noodles are almost cooked, melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Quickly drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss briefly to coat it with the butter. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and using a flat wooden spoon, mix quickly together for less than a minute until the eggs and noodles become creamy and thick. Do not cook the eggs too long or they will scramble and ruin the dish. Serve immediately.
Mix together flour, flax seed meal, almond flour, splenda granular, cinnamon, water, cinnamon. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. In a bowl with tight fitting lid, put the flour. Add chicken, in batches, and shake to coat. Shake off excess flour and place pieces in a greased 8x8 baking dish,. Making sure not to lay them flat. They should have the same shape as they were in the package. In a small bowl, mix the honey, soy sauce, garlic and seasonings. Pour evenly over the chicken. Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes, basting occasionally with the sauce. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees and boil water. In a 13x9 casserole dish, combine rice and contents of seasoning packet. Add boiling water to dish and mix well. Add chicken, sprinkle with garlic powder. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Add broccoli and cheese. Cover and continue to bake for another 8-10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center.

Put the potatoes in a large bowl. Sprinkle with the pickle juice and gentle toss. Mix 1 cup mayonnaise with mustard, onion, dill, pickle and eggs add to potatoes stirring in and season with salt and pepper. Adding more mayonnaise to the creaminess you desire. Serve room temperature or chilled.

In a large saute pan combine the butter, shallots, garlic clove, white beans, fresh parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley, white wine

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and sauté for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth, soy sauce, scallions, sugar snap pea, fresh bean sprout, fresh mushrooms, ginger, noodles. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Add the cooked noodles and heat for 2-3 minutes. Serve hot.

Saute sausage, breaking into small pieces. Remove from pan. Pour off excess grease. Cut rabe into bite size pieces and saute in olive oil. Add garlic and saute another minute or two. Add chicken broth and simmer until rabe is tender. Add butter and cooked sausage to pan. Stir until butter is melted. Pour over cooked shells. Serve with parmesan cheese.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine rice, broth, and salt. Bring to a boil. Decrease heat to low and cook, covered, until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add in onion. Saute about 5 minutes, until tender. Stir sauteed onions into cooked rice. Add in parsley and fluff with a fork before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Coat the bottom of a casserole dish with olive oil. Line the bottom of the dish with the squash making sure that they are laid out evenly and sprinkle with vinegar. Top with even amounts of garlic, basil and celery salt. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add about one cube of cheese per slice. Cook for another 15 minutes remove and let cool for five minutes and serve on crackers or eat by themselves.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla on medium speed until well blended. Add eggs. Mix just until blended and pour into oreo pie crust. Bake for 35-40 minutes until center is about set. Cool for 45-60 minutes. While cooling, microwave caramels and milk for 3 minutes on high or until melted. Pour caramel over cooled cheesecake. Sprinkle chocolate chips and pecans on cake. Refrigerate for at least two hours.

Heat oil in medium saute pan or saucepan over medium-high heat. Fry onion until crisp and reddish-brown, about 10 minutes, then drain on paper towels. Put garlic and chile in saucepan and fry for 20 seconds or until just beginning to brown. Add lentils and water. Partially cover and cook for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are soft. Serve lentils with onions on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13x9 pan with pam. Put hash browns in pan and add salt and pepper to taste. Top with grated cheese and pour half and half over top. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with paprika, if desired. Bake for 1 to 1. 5 hours. I like to cover mine with foil and then uncover the last half an hour.

Combine tuna steaks, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, jalap

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine first seven ingredients, stir well. Lightly spray pam in a medium size casserole dish and pour in bean mixture. Place slices of bacon over top of beans. Cover and bake extra 15 minutes. Uncover and bake extra 15 minutes.

In small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Serve with dressing.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut chicken breasts in half to butterfly them into cutlets. Sprinkle with some salt and pepper melt margarine in skillet and brown chicken in margarine and transfer to a 9x13 pan. Pour soup and sour cream into same skillet and whisk until smooth and warm. Place ham on top of chicken and top with a slice of swiss cheese. Pour soup mixture over top and bake uncovered for 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar. Mix well. Pour dressing over salad mixture, stirring well. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together first five ingreadients until there are no lumps. Add the water, vanilla, butter, and nuts. Slowly stir together until just combined. Pour into a lightly greased 8-inch square or 9-inch round cake pan. Bake the cake for 45 minutes. When the cake is done, the top will be set, and the bottom bubbly.

Place the chickpeas, garlic, onion, coriander, cumin, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add the chickpeas, garlic, onion, coriander, cumin, salt and pepper. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes. While the chickpeas are cooking, the water will begin to evaporate, and you will notice more of the chickpeas. That is when the sauce is ready. Add the cooked chickpeas, garlic, onion, coriander, cumin, salt and pepper. Add the cooked chickpeas, garlic, onion, cori

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix cake mix, oats, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Melt butter and pour over the top of the dry cake mixture and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle this over apples. Bake 35-40 minutes until golden.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add bread, butter, chutney, ham, cheddar cheese, pickled onion, and beat until smooth. Add ham, cheddar cheese, pickled onion, pickled onion, and beat until smooth. Add pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled onion, pickled

Heat oven to 400. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Remove from oven and squeeze lemon juice onto asparagus.
Mix first four ingredients and add hot water. Knead well. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into desired size. Fry in hot grease.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add tomatoes and saute until fragrant. Add garlic and saute until

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 11 x 17-inch pan with pam non stick cooking spray. Combine flour and baking soda in bowl and set aside. Cream butter with sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Alternately stir in raisins and flour mixture. Fold in remaining ingredients. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and then cut into bars.

Drain spinach well, pressing between layers of paper towels and set aside. Cut 2-3 cheese slices into small triangles, and reserve for garnish. Cover bottom and sides of a lightly greased 9 or10-inch pieplate with remaining muenster slices, overlapping cheese as needed. Combine spinach, onion and next 5 ingredients. Spoon into cheese-lined pieplate. Bake 350 for 45 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with reserved cheese triangles and pimiento strips, if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except the grated cheddar cheese. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, top with grated cheddar, bake for 5 minutes longer. If desired, roasted garlic may be added to mixture.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine dijon mustard, garlic, ground red pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cracker crumb, parmesan cheese, dried sage, dried rosemary, ground black pepper, chicken thighs, bran flakes, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan cheese, parmesan

Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut cinnamon rolls in half. Place in pan in 1 layer. Pour butter evenly over cinnamon. Pour ice cream evenly. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Turn pan over onto serving platter.

Pour the egg whites into a large mixing bowl. Gently stir in the instant coffee until dissolved. Gently stir in the splenda and vanilla. Gradually whisk in the pudding mix until no longer grainy, then briskly whisk until thick. Chill well before serving.

Heat oven to 200oc. Make a small cut at the top of each fig and push in a little piece of gorgonzola. Wrap each fig in a slice of prosciutto. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes. The cheese will melt and the prosciutto will be crisp. Serve immediately on rocket leaves dressed in olive oil and salt, and finish with a little finely cracked pepper.

Heat oil in a pot and saute garlic until golden brown. Add onion, potato, rice, broth, parsley, and 2 cups water. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add more water if soup appears too thick. Stir in cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and let cool completely. Frost cupcakes with vanilla frosting, and garnish each one with a reserved cherry.

Using electric mixer, mix cream cheese and butter very well. Gradually mix in milk. Mix in flour and jalapenos. Stir in corn. Pour into a 9x9 greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes, or until bubbling and golden brown on top.

Preheat oven to 325f. Beat egg whites until soft peaks begin to form. Add sugar, salt, and vanilla. Beat until stiff peaks form and turn glossy. Fold in nuts and coat well with the egg white mixture. Melt butter in a 9x13 baking pan by placing pan in the oven. Evenly spread coated nuts over melted butter in pan. Bake for 30 minutes, stirring and turning nuts about every 8 minutes, or until butter no longer remains in pan. Place hot nuts on foil and allow to cool. May be stored in an airtight container for several weeks.

Cook chicken in boiling water, cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Take out, let cool, and shred. Peel cucumbers into strips, skin and all, and put the strips in a large bowl. Put chicken shreds on tempeh, celery, red bell peppers, dill pickle, scallions, fresh parsley, soy mayonnaise, yellow mustard, lemon juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray a non-stick 8 inch round cake pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside. Add cake mix and remaining ingredients for the cake to a medium sized mixing bowl. With electric mixer, beat on medium speed 2 minutes or until thoroughly mixed and batter is smooth. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted off center comes out clean. Cool on a rack for 10 minutes, invert onto wire rack and cool completely before frosting. For the frosting, add all ingredients except milk to a medium size bowl. Garnish as desired, strawberries make a nice garnish.

Preheat grill. Finely dice the sausages. Add them to a bowl with sausages, ground beef, pineapple, salt, thyme and sage, mixing well. Shape into patties approximately 6 cm in size. Mix together the flour and finely chopped parsley on a plate and coat each patty. Grill for about 4 minutes until golden. Lower the heat and cook for a further 6-8 minutes.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.
Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add cashews and stir until mixture is smooth and bubby. Remove from heat and add frozen snow peas. Stir and heat though.

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt butter and margarine over low heat, stirring until well blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with whisk until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

Mix the cherry jell-o, cream cheese, nuts, cola, dark sweet cherry in a large bowl. Spread mixture evenly over crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool completely, then spread an even layer of cool whip over pie, then top with cherry pie filling. Refrigerate 2-3 hours before serving.

Cook pasta until half done. Drain. Return pasta to the pot. Add cream, butter, garlic, tomato sauce, broccoli, salt and pepper. Bring to a hard boil. When noodles are fully cooked and sauce is starting to thicken, add mushrooms and stir to combine. Remove from the heat. Add cheese. Toss and serve.

Heat oil in non-stick skillet. Cook onion until translucent. Add pepper and tomatoes. Cover and simmer about 10 minutes. Add capers, olives, parsley. Put flounder fillet on top and spoon some juices over it. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes, until done.

In a large skillet, melt 1 tbs butter over medium high heat. Add the shrimp and garlic. Cook, tossing, until the shrimp starts to turn pink on the outside but is stil translucent on the inside, about 2 min. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Reduce the heat to medium and in the same skillet, melt the remaining butter. Add the shallot and cook for 30 secs, whisking constantly. Add the wine, broth, and mustard - whisking constantly. Simmer until it is as thick as heavy cream, about 5 minute. Return the shrimp to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook until the shrimp are opaque throughout, about 2 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Cover and let cook for about 2 hours.

In a medium saucepan mix all ingredients together. Bring to a light boil, whisking constantly until thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly then whisk in mayo. Season with salt and pepper. Cool completely before adding to you potato or pasta salad.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray large baking sheet with nonstick spray. Toss onion and next 5 ingredients together on prepared baking sheet. Spread in single layer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake vegetables until tender and brown around edges, stirring occasionally, about 35 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the onions, sausages and pecans. Saut until onions are just softened, about 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, until eggs are firm but not dry. Remove from heat and set aside. Meanwhile, heat a panini maker or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Divide sausage mixture into 4 portions and mound each portion on one slice of bread. Top each with bocconcini slices and top with remaining bread slices. Lightly butter the outside of each panini. Cook until both sides of each panini are golden. Serve immediately. Serve warm and garnish with maple syrup and fresh fruit if desired.

Cook frozen green beans according to package directions, using the lowest time given. In a large skillet, fry bacon until desired doneness. Drain on paper towel and return to skillet. Add cooked green beans, chicken broth, and onion powder to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for ten minutes or until most of the liquid is evaporated, stirring occasionally.

Boil potatoes in skins and cool, peel and grate. Combine with 4 tblsp butter, melted. Stir in cheese until almost melted. Blend with rest of the ingredients. Put in a 2 quart pan sprayed with cooking oil. Dot the top with 2 tblsp butter. Cover and bake at 300 about 25 minutes.

Saute the onion and bacon in the olive oil in a large pot until the onion is softened and the bacon is cooked through. Add the cabbage to the pot. It will take up a lot of room but will wilt down as it cooks. Cook until the cabbage is done, stirring frequently. It will take about ten to twelve minutes. If you want a softer cabbage, cover the pot and let it steam for about an extra five minutes or so. If desired, a little bit of sugar and vinegar can be added near the end of cooking time.
Place fillets in a greased baking dish. Cover fillets with aluminum foil. Bake in preheated 350-degree oven for about 15 minutes or until flaky. Sprinkle with parsley and season with salt and pepper.

Spray cookie sheets with cooking spray. In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Stir in corn syrup and egg white until blended. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 7 to 9 minutes or just until set. Do not overbake. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350c. Cream together sugar and margarine. Add eggs, beat till light and fluffy. Combine dry ingredients in another bowl. Mix together orange juice and milk. Add the orange juice mixture alternately with the dry ingredients to the batter, beating till blended. Fold in orange rind and walnuts. Bake in a loaf pan about for 45 minutes or until the cake is cooked when tested with a skewer.

Heat oil on medium heat using a large skillet. Add chicken breast, coconut milk, sweet basil, eggplants, green curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, thai chile, kaffir lime leaf, spaghetti. Stir-fry about 2 minutes. Add chicken breast, coconut milk,

Boil potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until fork-tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Mash potatoes, adding cream cheese until it is blended. Stir in milk, chives, and seasonings. Heat on medium heat until just warmed through, then serve at once.

In a large pot with boiling salted water cook pasta until al dente. Drain. In a large saucepan heat the italian dressing and olive oil together over medium heat. Add drained spaghetti. Toss well to coat. Add garlic & onions. Stir-fry about 2 minutes. Add swiss chard, broth, salt and pepper and cook until greens are wilted. Stir frequently. Remove from heat & set aside. Cook spaghetti until al dente. Toss all together and serve at once. Can subsitute spinach for swiss chard.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl. The dough should form a ball -- not too dry, but not too sticky either. If you have mixed for a long time, and there is still a lot of flour in the bowl, add a tiny bit more water. If the dough is too wet, add more flour. Cover the ball of dough with a thin dusting of flour, so you can remove it from the bowl. Using floured hands, spread the dough onto a greased cookie sheet -- the dough should be thin enough cover the entire sheet. Bake for 25 minutes at 350. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool, and cut into 12 slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and two sugars until well combined. Beat in vanilla pudding mix. Add eggs, one at a time, until well incorporated. Mix in vanilla extract. In another small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just incorporated. Fold in m&ms and white chocolate chips. Drop tablespoon size cookie dough onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes, or until just turning golden brown. Cool on cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs and egg whites. Beat in milk, honey and vanilla. Stir in bread cubes. Pour into 8 inch baking dish, sprayed with a non-stick spray. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Serve hot.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add onion and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add spinach and cook until wilted, stirring occasionally. Add basil and cook until wilted, stirring occasionally. Add spinach and cook

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In small bowl, combine desiccated coconut, rice bubbles, glace cherries, dark chocolate chips, margarine, golden syrup, coconut essence. Mix in desiccated coconut, rice bubbles, glace cherries, dark chocolate chips, margarine, golden syrup, coconut essence. Mix in desiccated coconut, rice bubbles, glace cherries, dark chocolate chips

In large bowl, combine all ingredients and mix into a soft dough. Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead 20 times. Divide dough into fourths and roll each quarter into a 12 inch long rope. Cut each rope into inch pieces, and set on a floured surface. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Roll each piece of dough across the tines of a fork to get groves on it and drop it into the pot of water. Cook gnocchi until it floats to the top. Drain and serve.

Preheat oven 350 degrees. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix peaches and raspberries, and place in bottom of 3 qt casserole dish. Using fork, stir together flour, sugar, baking powder and cinnamon. Stir in eggs using fork. Batter will be quite dry. Pour over top of fruit. Pour melted butter of top. Place in oven and cook for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Add hot water to stuffing mix. Stir till blended. Set aside. Saute italian sausage in a large nonstick skillet over med-high heat until nicely browned. Add vegetables to skillet, saute until crisp tender. Drain any oil in skillet. Place sausage mixture into a 13 x 9 pan. Cover with tomato sauce. Cover with prepared stuffing. Bake 25 minutes or until heated throughout.

Preheat the oven to 400f grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Using a food processor, puree 1 cup corn. In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chorizo. In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, pureed corn and tortilla crumbs. Add the onion-chorizo mixture and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and bake until set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the scallions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9-inch springform pan. In a large bowl combine bisquick baking mix and sugar. Stir in cheese and bacon. In a bowl beat the egg and milk. Add to cheese mixture just until moistened, then pour into a greased and floured springform pan. Bake for about 35-40 mins or until it tests done. Cool 10 mins remove sides of pan and serve warm.

Melt butter in dutch oven. Add rice, onion, carrot, dried oregano, quinoa, chicken broth, salt, frozen peas, lemon juice, black pepper. Cook on medium heat till rice is light brown with a nutty aroma stirring often. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Add rest of ingredients, almost over season to taste. Bring to boil on medium heat. Turn off heat. Cover tightly with foil then put lid on top. Bake for 45 minutes then remove from oven and let rest for 15 minutes. Take lid and foil off, fluff with fork and serve.

Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties, add onion, broth and mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Heat onion to boiling. Remove patties. Mix water and cornstarch. Add to skillet and stir until thickened.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a large baking pan with cooking spray. Rub the jug barbados on both sides with lemon juice, then salt and pepper them to taste. Place the jug barbados in the baking disk and sprinkle evenly with tarragon. Cover evenly with sour cream. Bake for about 15 minutes until fish is done but not over cooked. Sprinkle with chives and parsley.

Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion, garlic, and bay leaf, and saute until onion is lightly browned. Mix tomatoes, curry powder, and salt into the skillet, and continue cooking about 5 minutes. Mix in the chicken, and cook 15 to 20 minutes, until no longer pink and juices run clear. Reduce skillet heat to low. Stirring constantly, gradually blend in the coconut milk over a period of about 10 minutes. Mix in the chicken, and cook 15 to 20 minutes,
Mix all of the ingredients together and add to the eggs. Pour into the pan and bake at 350f for about 45-50 minutes until set. Cut into pie-shaped pieces and serve hot.

In a medium saucepan combine squash, onions, carrots, broth, and spices. Simmer, uncovered, until squash is very tender, about 40 minutes. Puree soup in a blender or food processor with the butter. Whisk cream into soup. Serve in wide, shallow bowls with a dollop of sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Place fish in baking pan. Mix orange juice and butter. Pour half this mixture over the fish. Sprinkle the rind over. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour remaining orange mixture over. Bake another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 180c. Cut potatoes into large wedges. Place on greased oven trays, bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Combine oil, garlic, herbs, mustard and juice in a bowl. Add potatoes and toss until potatoes are well coated with mixture. Return potatoes to oven trays and drizzle with melted butter. Cook under hot grill until golden brown, turning potatoes when necessary. Serve sprinkled with salt if desired.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place salmon in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over salmon. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl mix sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, egg whites, pecan halves. Add pecans and toss well. Drizzle honey and oil over spiced nuts and mix well so they are evenly coated. Spread on greased baking sheet and bake 7 - 10 minutes until sugar is caramelized. Let it cool for 5 minutes and take it of the sheet otherwise they might stick to the bottom. If that happens put it back in oven to melt the sticky sugar.

Place first 5 ingredients in container and microwave on high for 1 minute, stir till smooth, it may need a further 30 seconds. Stir in chopped almonds and vanilla and pour into a foil lined 5 x 8 inch rectangular pan, place in fridge to set whilst you prepare the top layer. Place white chocolate and second lot of condensed milk in micro container and micro for 30 seconds, stir and remicro for a further 15 seconds if needed till smooth. Place in fridge to set.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add in mushrooms and garlic. Cook about 5 minutes or until onions are tender, stirring occasionally. Transfer mixture to a greased 3-quart baking dish. Stir in the water, barley, dry soup mix, thyme, and salt. Bake, covered, at 350 for about 1 hour and 15 minutes or until onions are tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand, covered, for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 190 degrees. Line a 20cm pie dish with baking paper. Place 1 sheet of pastry over the paper. Trim edges. Place bacon, mushrooms, tomato and onion in pastry case. Season with black pepper. Crack eggs over filling. Top pie with remaining sheet of pastry. Trim and crimp edges. Glaze top of pie with milk. Cut a vent in centre of pie. Bake for 25-20 minutes or until pastry is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350f and grease 8-inch square pan. In large mixing bow, beat egg beaters and vanilla until frothy. Gradually add splenda brown sugar, continuing to beat after each addition. Add flour continuing to beat after each addition. Stir in apples and nuts. Pour into greased pan. Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

In a large wok, fry onion in oil for about 5 minutes, until softened. Add the garlic and cumin, and then fry for another minute. Add spinach in stages, stirring until leaves begin to wilt. Stir in chickpeas, butter and salt and pepper to taste. Reheat.

Preheat oven to 190c grease a patty tin or use paper cups. Sift flour and baking powder. Cream fat and sugar until mixture is light and creamy. Add in vanilla essence. Beat egg and add it gradually to the mixture, beating well after each addition. Fold in the sifted flour with a metal spoon. Add a little milk if necessary to give it a soft dropping consistency. Mix in the raisins. Fill greased patty tin or paper cups half full with the mixture. Bake for 20 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat the oil and garlic over medium heat. Add veal, butter, scallions, mushrooms, paprika, flour, white wine, whipping cream, salt and pepper, rice, and saute until tender. Add paprika and saute for an additional 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper and saute for an additional 2 minutes. Add paprika and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla, followed by the sifted baking powder, sifted flour and milk. Half fill paper cases standing on baking tray. Bake for 10-12 minutes. When cold, decorate the top with jam or icing or just icing sugar, if desired.

Place potatoes in water and 1 tsp salt and simmer until tender, about 15 to 18 minutes. Drain and run under cold water to cool. Cut into quarters. Meanwhile, cook broccoli florets, bacon, dried cranberries, sunflower seeds, mayonnaise, sugar, white wine vinegar, shredded cheddar cheese in a large mixing bowl. Pour dressing over salad mixture, stirring well. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll squares into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked sausage, cooked bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute squash until browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add water, salt and pepper. Simmer until squash is tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in basil.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over high heat. Add zucchini and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add zucchini and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender and tomatoes are heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil and pine nuts and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Spray a deep baking dish, or roaster with non stick spray. Combine 1 tbs of olive oil, the juice and zest of both lemons, plus the additional lemon juice, and the 4 cloves of garlic minced in a small bowl. Place the chicken in the roasting pan. Sprinkle liberally with the lemon pepper salt. Pour the lemon mixture over all- you can throw the lemon rinds into the baking dish too. Bake at 400 for about 45 minutes to an hour, turning the chicken over halfway through baking. I sometimes make this, and seal it in a ziplock bag in the freezer, then when you are ready, thaw, dump in the roaster and bake- just adding the lemon pepper salt. My family likes this when i take the sauce from the chicken, combine it with a small amount of half and half and serve it over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix chile peppers and cream cheese. Stir in chopped turkey. Place the tortillas in a microwave oven. Heat for 1 minute, or until the tortillas are softened. Spread about 2 heaping tablespoons of the chile pepper mixture on each tortilla, and roll up. Place the rolled tortillas, seam-side down, in single layer in the prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine the salsa and beans. Spoon the mixture over the enchiladas. Sprinkle the top with cheese. Bake 20 minutes or til bubbly and lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix cake mix, oats, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Melt butter and pour over the top of the dry cake mixture and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle this over apples. Bake 35-40 minutes until golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar, cornstarch, sugar

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease tube pan. Mix first four ingredients in bowl. Separate biscuits into 20 pieces, then cut biscuits into 4 pieces. Toss biscuits with bacon and other ingredients. Put all this into tube pan and drizzle with butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until egg is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced potatoes, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Brush the pork chops with olive oil, and rub the breadcrumbs onto both sides of each pork chop. Place pork chops on top of the vegetables. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender.

Boil spaghetti according to package. In a large skillet heat oil. Add garlic and saute. Add salmon, broth, parsley, cream cheese, milk and salt. Heat on med. Heat until cream cheese is melted and everything is well heated. Serve over spaghetti. Garnish with olives.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop onions and slice mushrooms. Melt margarine in skillet. Saute onions until transparent. Add mushrooms. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Allow to cool. Mix together egg, flour, non-dairy milk and wine. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour into pie crust. Form lattice strips from second crust and place on top of quiche. Bake for 2 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in dish. Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle dry cake mix over cherries, then spread pecans over cake mix. Cut margarine into thin slices and place over pecans. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired.

Mix soup, water, rice, onion powder and black pepper in 2-qt shallow baking dish. Top with chicken. Sprinkle chicken with additional pepper & salt. Cover and bake at 375 for 45 min or until chicken is no longer pink and rice is done. Uncover and sprinkle cheese over chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix butter, brown sugar, egg, cocoa, baking soda, and salt with fork together. Mix in remaining ingredients except chocolate chips and pour into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over batter. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until well blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with whisk until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the rice and saute for about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, mix well, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the stock, rice, salt and pepper, mix well and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer very gently for about 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Slice avocado lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, garlic salt. Stir and mash the ingredients together until guacamole is preferred consistency. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease muffin tins. Place all dry ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix up with an electric mixer. Add the liquids and mix smooth. Place 2 tablespoons of batter in the bottom of each of the greased muffin cups. Add 1 tablespoon of crunchy style peanut butter. Add the remaining bit of batter and bake for approx. 25 minutes or until a tooth pick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 300f. Coat an 8-inch square pan using nonstick cooking spray. Combine oats, flour, wheat germ, and cinnamon. Stir until well mixed. Fold in raisins. Press mixture into pan and bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool to room temperature, cut into 12 bars and serve.

In a medium saucepan combine zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, curry powder, zucchini, baking potato, broth, salt. Simmer, uncovered, until zucchini is very tender, about 40 minutes. Puree soup in a blender or food processor with the butter. Whisk cream into soup. Serve in wide, shallow bowls with a dollop of sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13-inch x 9-inch x 2-inch baking dish. Crush butter-flavored crackers either in a ziploc bag with a rolling pin or bottle of sherry, or in a food processor. Melt butter over low heat, and place in a shallow bowl. In another bowl, combine the crackers, cheese and seasonings. Dip fillets in butter, then coat with crumbs. Place coated cod fillets in baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 15-20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Stir together honey, butter and crumbled bacon in a small bowl until smooth and set aside. Place carrots and water into an ungreased 9-by-9-inch baking dish, cover with foil and bake 30 minutes. Remove foil and stir in butter mixture. Bake another 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Melt butter on medium heat in a 10-inch skillet. Add shallots and sage. Cook for 2 minutes. Add wine, salt and pepper. Boil on high for 1 minute. Stir in mushrooms. Reduce heat to medium. Cover. Cook for 5 minutes. Uncover. Cook for 12 minutes or until tender, stirring.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Stir in corn syrup and egg whites until throughly blended. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 1 inch apart onto prepared sheets. Bake 7 to 9 minutes, or until set. Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

In a medium size glass bowl mix together the tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, onion, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper. Combine well. Add in the juice. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving. Serve with fresh tortilla chips.

Defrost frozen chocolate pecan pie. Combine eggs and next 5 ingredients. Stir in kahlua. Pour into pie shell. Bake 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool on a rack. 1 frozen deep-dish pastry shell may be substituted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celcius. Put the chopped apples into a large bowl and sprinkle with the lemon juice. Combine the nuts, sultanas, sugar, flour, salt and baking powder and mix well. Stir this mixture into the apples. Add in the vanilla essence and mix again. Pour the mixture into a lightly oiled cake tin and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until lightly browned on top. Serve hot or cold. For a moister cake. Add to the ingredients a little fruit juice or water.

Preheat oven to 425. To make cinnamon mixture combine 3 t. Sugar with 1 teaspoon cinnamon. In a pan combine pie filling, lemon juice & nutmeg. Bake for 10 minutes. Cut biscuits in half & dip in melted butter, turn in cinnamon mixture and place on hot apple mixture. Bake 15 minutes.

Heat olive oil in frying pan, cook sausages for 8-10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Return pan to medium heat and add garlic, crushed and sundried tomatoes, white wine and cream and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions, drain. Stir cooked sausage, spring onions and sage through sauce, season to taste. Divide pasta among serving bowls and spoon over sauce.

In skillet, heat onions over medium heat, add pork chops, onion, water, tomato basil soup mix, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil, return pork chops to skillet. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes or until tender. Spoon sauce over pork chops.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small cubes. In large pot mix vegetables, soups, butter and chicken. Cook on medium heat for 10 minutes. Put soup mixture in 10 x 13 inch baking dish. Unroll cresent rolls and cover mixture with unrolled cresents. Bake for 20 minutes or until cresent cover is golden brown. Let cool pie cool down for about 5 minutes before serving.

Combine almonds, white fish fillets, water, vermouth, salt, fresh ground pepper, butter, parsley, lemon wedge, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In foil lined roasting pan, toss carrots with oil and cayenne and season with salt. Arrange in single layer, using two pans if needed. Roast tossing one halfway through for 30-40 minutes, or until tender. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, zest and lemon juice. Season with salt. Drizzled over carrots and toss to coat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a pan large enough to hold the chops in a single layer with non-stick spray. Season the pork steaks or chops with salt& pepper. Arrange them in single layer in the prepared pan. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the chops from the pan and pour off the fat. Place the apples in the pan and top with the baked chops. Bake uncovered, basting occasionally, for 45 minutes or until pork is tender.
Heat the oil in a pan and saut the tofu for 5-6 minutes. Add the tofu and cook for 2-5 minutes or until the tofu is done. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Brush a large baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Put green beans, onion, and garlic in dish, drizzle with remaining oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring beans at least 3 times. When tender, remove beans from oven and transfer to bowl. Immediately drizzle with vinegar. Add hearts of palm, tomatoes, pine nits and pepper to taste and toss. Serve warm or room temperature.

Heat oil in a large saute or fry pan until very hot. Add vegetables all at once, spreading in an even layer. Do not stir until bottom of layer begins to brown. Flip and stir to get unbrowned pieces to bottom. Let cook until beginning to brown. The trick here is to keep heat high and brown pieces without overcooking or burning them. If pieces are browned, but not soft enough for your taste, turn off heat and cover pan for a few minutes.

In a large mixing bowl, dissolve sugar and jell-o in 2 cups boiling water. Add to the jell-o mixture the juice of both oranges, the zest of one orange, chopped nuts, and the entire can of crushed pineapple. Shred apples and cranberries. Add to jell-o. Mix well. Chill overnight or until set.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Thaw potatoes between layers of paper towels to remove excess moisture. Press into bottom and up sides of an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Drizzle with butter. Bake for 25 minutes until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Combine ham, cheese and red and green peppers. Spoon into potato shell. Combine eggs, milk, salt and pepper, stirring well. Pour over ham mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Place tuna, pickle relish, honey mustard, salt and pepper. Mix well. Spread tuna mixture evenly over bottom halves of rolls and top with remaining roll halves. Wrap each sandwich in foil. Place on a baking sheet into a pre-heated 350 oven for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Unwrap and serve immediately.

Heat apple juice in 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil. Stir in apples, green onions, chives and curry powder and cook 1 to 2 minutes, stirring. Add broth and bring to boil. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Heat the oil in a medium sized saucepan, add the onion, carrot, garlic, celery rib, apple, vegetable oil, dry red wine, ruby port, reduced-sodium chicken broth, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 4-5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat 12 cup muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray. Mix carrot, egg, cheese, and chives. Add flour and baking powder, stir. Spoon batter equally among muffin cups. Bake 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

Cream butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Add flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Mix well. Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients, and lastly stir in the oats and chocolate chips. Form into small balls with hands and bake on cookie sheets lined with parchment paper for 8-10 minutes or until very light golden, they should almost look un-cooked. Store in a tupperware box to keep them chewy.

Scoop egg yolks into bowl. Set aside egg whites. Add mayonniase, dijon mustard, dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, pepper and shrimp to egg yolks and stir to blend completely. Fill each egg white with yolk mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a medium baking dish with the olive oil spray to coat. Place the halved tomatoes, cut side up, in a single layer in the prepared dish. Sprinkle with the sea salt and lightly spray with more olive oil spray. Bake for 40 minutes or until tomatoes are lightly browned and tender. Meanwhile, combine the vinegar, oil and mustard in a small bowl and set aside. Mix the herbs and feta together and set aside. Remove tomatoes from oven when cooked and place them on a serving platter and sprinkle with the dressing and freshly ground black pepper. Serve.

In a large shallow baking pan, toast hazelnuts in 325 oven, 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar and salt, beating until stiff. Fold in toasted hazelnuts. Melt butter in same pan. Spread nut mixture on top. Bake 30 to 40 minutes at 325 or until nut are browned and butter is absorbed. Stir nuts thoroughly every 10 minutes during baking.

Heat oil in large saucepan over med-high heat 1-2 minutes and add garlic, onion, and mushrooms and saute until tender, add the greens and cook 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook the pasta. Mix the cooked ingredients together. Top with the sour cream and parmesan mix. Serves 4 people.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Arange shrimp in a single layer in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine lemon juice with butter, garlic, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper, and red pepper. Pour mixture over shrimp. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 minutes or until shrimp are done. Sprinkle parsley over shrimp. Serve immediately. Serving size is 3 ounces shrimp with 2 tablespoons sauce with 3 points per serving.

Place chicken in slow cooker. Combine flour, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper

Place the pork loin roast in a heavy large plastic ziploc bag. In a bowl whisk together beer, corn syrup, onions, mustard, chili powder, garlic and black pepper. Pour the marinade over the roast. Seal the bag tightly and turn to coat the meat. Place the bag in a large bowl and place in the refrigerator for 8-24 hours. When ready to cook prepare the rotisserie. Remove the roast from the marinade and bring to almost room temperature before cooking. Place the pork on the spit then set over heat and baste every 10-15 minutes or the internal temperature reads 155-160f. Discard any remaining marinade. Remove the roast from the spit and let rest for 15 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place roast in a large roasting pan. Combine soup mix, broth and beer in a bowl and stir until soup mix is dissolved. Pour over roast and place onions around it. Bake for 2 to 3 hours, basting frequently, or until beef is tender and looks stringy when pulled with a fork. If roast starts getting too crispy, cover pan with foil or lid. Slice meat thinly and serve on rolls. Serve juices in individual cups or bowls to dip sandwiches into.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place sprouts, butter, and almonds on a rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Roast, stirring, until golden brown and tender, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Immediately dress with honey and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat oil in a skillet and saute the pork over medium high heat for 3 minutes, flip and continue cooking for another 3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. Pour in the marinade cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. Pour in the marinade

Heat oil in skillet on med, add onions, cook until soft. Add celery, cook until crisp tender. Increase heat to med hi, add peas. Cook until peas are heated through. Stir in celery leaves, salt and pepper.
